title: Silas H. Stepp Letters
creator: Stepp, Silas H.
description: Seventeen letters written by Silas H. Stepp to his wife during his time as a Confederate soldier during the Civil War. In June of 1864, he was captured by Union forces at Jackson's Mills, North Carolina. First imprisoned at Point Lookout, Maryland, then sent to Elmira Prison, New York, in July 1864, Stepp died of pneumonia in Elmira on January 2, 1865. Most of the letters were written prior to his capture, but three of them contain details of his capture and imprisonment.
subject: Civil War||United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865
